intro: Helianthus chartaceus, commonly known as the paperleaf sunflower, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the southeastern United States and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and heart-shaped, papery leaves. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
